verses.verse: And Job answered and said:
I have heard many such things. You are all troublesome comforters.
Is there an end to words of wind? Or what provokes you that you answer?
I also could speak as you. If your soul were in the place of my soul, I could bind words against you and shake at you with my head.
I might strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips could spare you.
If I speak, my pain is not held back; and if I forbear, what part of me goes away?
But now He has made me weary. You have desolated all my company.
And You have plucked me; for it is a witness, and my failure rises up against me; yea, it answers to my face.
His anger has torn, and retained animosity against me; He gnashes at me with His teeth; my Adversary sharpens his eyes at me.
They have gaped at me with their mouth and with scorn struck my cheek; they gather themselves together against me.
God has delivered me to the perverse one; and He has pushed me headlong to the hands of the wicked ones.
I was at ease, but He has shattered me; yea, He has also taken hold on my neck and broken me to bits; and He has set me up as a target for Him.
His archers surround me; He splits my kidneys and has no pity; He pours out my gall on the ground.
He breaks me with break on the face of break; He runs on me like a mighty one.
I have sewed sackcloth on my skin, and I have thrust my horn in the dust.
My face is reddened from weeping; and the shadow of death is on my eyelids,
though no violence is in my palm, and my prayer is pure.
O earth, do not cover my blood, and let not be a place for my cry.
Even now, behold! My witness is in Heaven and my Testifier is on high.
My scorners are my friends; my eye pours out tears to God.
O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleads for his friend!
For years of number will come; and I shall not return the way I shall go.
